Interface LogFilter

All Known Subinterfaces:
LogEntryFilter
All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultLogEntryFilter, StandardLogFilter
public interface LogFilter
The LogEntryFilter interface represents a filter used to determine if a LogEntry should be included or excluded.

The LogEntryFilter interface is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final LogFilter
    ALL_PASS_FILTER
    A LogEntryFilter that allows all log entries to pass through.

  • Field Details

    • ALL_PASS_FILTER

      static final LogFilter ALL_PASS_FILTER
      A LogEntryFilter that allows all log entries to pass through.

      This filter implementation always returns true, indicating that all log entries should be included and none filtered out.

  • Method Details

    • allPass

      static LogFilter allPass()
      Returns a LogEntryFilter that allows all log entries to pass through.
      Returns:
      a LogEntryFilter that allows all log entries to pass through

    • name

      String name()
      Retrieves the name associated with this filter.
      Returns:
      the name of the filter as a String

    • test

      boolean test(Instant instant, String loggerName, LogLevel lvl, String mrk, Supplier<String> msg, String location, @Nullable Throwable t)
      Tests if a log entry, specified by its components, should be processed.
      Parameters:
      instant - the timestamp of the log entry
      loggerName - the name of the logger that generated the log entry
      lvl - the log level of the log entry
      mrk - the marker associated with the log entry, can be null
      msg - the message of the log entry
      location - the location where the log entry was generated, typically a code context such as a class or method name
      t - the throwable associated with the log entry, can be null
      Returns:
      true, if the log entry should be processed, false if it should be filtered out
